intro: Fuchsia jahnii, commonly known as the Andean fuchsia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking, pendulous flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple, often with a contrasting throat. Fuchsia jahnii thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
